learning_outcomes.description: Solve a variety of first order and second order Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs)
Derive properties of the hyperbolic functions and apply them in various mathematical contexts.
Understand and apply aspects of the theory of multi-dimensional integrals, using a variety of coordinate systems.
Apply differential calculus to the context of vector functions. Specifically, work with Grad, Div and Curl and understand their significance.
Apply integral calculus to the context of vector functions. Specifically, use surface and flux integrals, and the theorems of Green, Gauss and Stokes.
Understand and apply eigenvalues, eigenvectors and diagonalisation of matrices in a variety of contexts.
Apply concepts of orthogonality and inner product spaces to the method of least squares, best fit and function approximation
Model and solve problems with real-world application using mathematical techniques covered in this course.
Present clear and concise mathematical arguments in assignments and exams.

assessments.task_description: The assignment problems will cover material from the live streamed lectures and the online only lectures. It will be available from the course Blackboard page.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments must be submitted online via Blackboard/GradeScope
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You are required to submit assessable items on time. If you fail to meet the submission deadline for any assessment item a penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark allocated for the assessment item will be deducted per day for up to 7 calendar days, at which point any submission will not receive any marks unless an extension has been approved. Each 24 hour block is recorded from the time the submission is due.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
